basics.description: **Note:** Please refer to the following before installing the solution: • Review the solution [Release Notes](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Solutions/Broadcom%20SymantecDLP/ReleaseNotes.md) • There may be [known issues](https://aka.ms/sentinelsolutionsknownissues) pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing. The [Broadcom Symantec Data Loss Prevention (DLP)](https://www.broadcom.com/products/cyber-security/information-protection/data-loss-prevention) connector allows you to easily connect your Symantec DLP with Microsoft Sentinel. 1. **Broadcom SymantecDLP via AMA** - This data connector helps in ingesting Broadcom SymantecDLP logs into your Log Analytics Workspace using the new Azure Monitor Agent. Learn more about ingesting using the new Azure Monitor Agent [here](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-cef-ama). **Microsoft recommends using this Data Connector**. 2. **Broadcom SymantecDLP via Legacy Agent** - This data connector helps in ingesting Broadcom SymantecDLP logs into your Log Analytics Workspace using the legacy Log Analytics agent. **NOTE:** Microsoft recommends installation of Broadcom SymantecDLP via AMA Connector. Legacy connector uses the Log Analytics agent which is about to be deprecated by **Aug 31, 2024,** and thus should only be installed where AMA is not supported. Using MMA and AMA on same machine can cause log duplication and extra ingestion cost [more details](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sentinel/ama-migrate). **Data Connectors:** 2, **Parsers:** 1 [Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel](https://aka.ms/azuresentinel) | [Learn more about Solutions](https://aka.ms/azuresentinelsolutionsdoc)

options.text: This Solution installs the data connector for Broadcom SymantecDLP. You can get Broadcom SymantecDLP CommonSecurityLog data in your Microsoft Sentinel workspace. After installing the solution, configure and enable this data connector by following guidance in Manage solution view.

The Solution installs a parser that transforms the ingested data into Microsoft Sentinel normalized format. The normalized format enables better correlation of different types of data from different data sources to drive end-to-end outcomes seamlessly in security monitoring, hunting, incident investigation and response scenarios in Microsoft Sentinel.
